title: Big two struggle as difficult summer continues
text:
Big two struggle as difficult summer continues 7 July 2015 Save 
Shares in Thomas Cook and Tui Group both fell yesterday as the pair continued to suffer in the wake of bad news in popular holiday destinations. 
Cook slipped to its lowest level since March when shares closed at £1.26 down 4.1% while Tui Group fell 2.3% to £10.17. 
Greece is still struggling to resolve its fiscal crisis and last month’s terrorist shooting in Tunisia is likely to have an impact on tourism in the region over the summer. 
Tui UK lost 30 of its customers in the Tunisia attack. The company is allowing the cancellation of its holidays up to July 9 and for bookings to be amended to other destinations up to October 31. 
According to analysts at Morgan Stanley, Tunisia represents around 3% of Cook’s summer volumes. 
“This is too early to quantify, but geopolitical events can cost operators tens of millions of pounds, only some of which is treated as an exceptional cost,” they said. 
Meanwhile Greece reportedly represents around 15% of Cook’s programme. 
“Operators see the current situation as a temporary issue, and more of an inconvenience to customers, with the potential for more discounts from hoteliers, which tour operators could pass on to stimulate demand,” Morgan Stanley said. 
Cook itself has insisted that it remains “business as usual” in Greece. Readers' comments (2) Anonymous | Tue, 7 Jul 2015 12:12 pm
